comment: Textbook is mandatory due to 8 reading quizzes. These quizzes are not easy, and require more than just skimming. Long tests with 50 multi-choice, 10 short answers, and 2 essay questions. The lectures were enjoyable, and showing up to class is important for notes outside of the powerpoints. Overall good teacher, maybe a little too much work though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Excellent history professor best I've had at this school. You will have to come to class, do the readings, and steady for the tests. If you're not willing to do that you may need to find a professor that will go easy on you.

Someone who tries to make their elective classes a real class, the course is far more involved than it should be, with multiple pop quizzes and VERY long tests with written sections that are graded very crucially. The quizzes are very short but are very difficult. Studying the power points are not enough to do well enough on tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Stricklen is a very sweet lady and encourages students to ask questions. She gives pop quizzes throughout the semester (5 questions, based on textbook readings) and has 6 reading assignments (pretty easy). The exams were on lock down & based on the lectures. You need to take detailed notes & study very well in order to be successful.

Ms. Stricklen was a wonderful teacher and she has an in depth knowledge of the subject and tries her best to teach the concepts. I loved her class; however, I used to get sleepy during the class, maybe it's the nature of the subject. I think she has towork on that area and make the class more interactive.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She gives a lot of test. 8 reading pop quizzes, so you have to ready every night or you won't be prepared. There a 4 map quizzes which are kind of easy. Then there are 3 exams which has 60 questions. The exams are hard. She adds questions that are not mentioned in power point and she grades tough on the written part.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: i will never recommend her class to anyone, not even my enemies. she knows the materials and most of the times she drifted away from the topic. 8 pop quizzes are very difficult even if you study, 4 map quizzes and 3 tests. reading is a must. for a class that is a elective should tnot be this difficult.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Do not take her !  Because,  There are pop quizzes and even if you study for it you won't make it 100.  The exams are more detailed even if you go through power points and take notes.  Please take another professor over her.  You don't wanna mess up your GPA :)  Else, you can try your luck.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY

comment: Show up to class and read. All the power points are online.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures

comment: This is by far the most rigorous core class I have taken. Reading is essential to passing. She gives 8 pop quizzes that are hard to ace even when you do read, and there are no review days whatsoever, so if you don't study for a test then you will not pass. There's 3 tests that make up 75% of your grade. Test are not cumulative. No final exam.

She is such a sweet woman but her tests are detailed and tough. They take serious studying. A LOT of quizzes, but they aren't too bad, but also require studying. Definitely not an easy A class, but she is always willing to help and she is very clear. 3 tests, no final. Powerpoints have no words on it, must come to class and take good notes.

you did have to work and attend class to pass, but she was totally lenient with things, pushed back quizzes, gave extra credit, never criticized, if many students missed a certain question on a test, she would throw it out. actually interesting to listen to, very polite and funny. i will for sure be taking her again.

Great professor with interesting classeslectures. Attendance isn't mandatory but if you want a good grade - be there. Quizzes are easy but the tests are a little difficult, definitely need to study. Would recommend. Cares about the subject and the students. Take good notes!!

Love her! She is super helpful and if you do your work its an easy class. Study the power points and take notes. There are map and document quizzes but they are an easy A. Reading helps but if you always go to class you can get away without it. Super nice and friendly. Her English accent is pretty entertaining too.

She was honestly fantastic and the majority of people complaining must be spoiled from high school. She doesn't give much of a workload, 4 tests with a take home essay portion(it's only 500 words). If you listen to what she says on the powerpoints in class and actually contribute she is a fantastic professor. really friendly and sweet too.

I think she makes history very interesting. The quizzes and essays are not that hard to write as long as you are willing to do them. Test are fairly hard. She is a very nice lady that wants you to do well.

She really isn't as bad as people say she is. She's a very nice lady and wants you to pass. Her tests can be a little misleading. Just make sure when you study the power points you know WHY everything happens. Why, the causes, the effects, etc of things are the main aspects of her tests. Quizzes are super easy..

Creates WAY too much work for a subject that is not supposed to be difficult.  She is very knowledgeable about the subject but with that she provides to much information that the testing material becomes unclear.  No study guides, a handwritten essay do with EVERY test, and a combo of map/article quizzes that feel like busy work.
Best Teacher I have ever had. She is a close friend even after I have taken her classes and she is so knowledgeable about history and loves teaching to all of her students

This class was more work than any class I have ever taken, and Im a junior. 4 map quizzes, 8 pop quizzes, 4 tests, 4 in depth essays, and mandatory attendance. Her quizzes and tests were extremely hard and consisted of random trick questions. No studyguide, and essays were due class after they were assigned (so if given on a monday, due wednesday)
